messages: 66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (10:02): ok, I see the issue was <trackgroup>
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (10:04): I think we want to make it as trivial as possible to handle the typical multi-language subtitle case, i.e. mutually exclusive <track>s
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (10:05): still, allowing for parallell tracks of some kinds seems reasonable.
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (10:05): if there's a less intrusive way I'd like that, I'm not particularly attached to <trackgroup>
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (10:20): good evening
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:21): oh cool, the wiki works again
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:38): updates the IDL definitions
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (10:42): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: do you already have a solution in mind?
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (10:49): 66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342: http://wiki.whatwg.org/wiki/Timed_tracks
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (10:50): 66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342: also note http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/video.html#the-track-element
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (10:59): 040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721: I've skimmed what little there is in the spec, it seems to disallow two <track>s of the same kind/lang/label
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (11:00): oh, nice figure: http://wiki.whatwg.org/wiki/Timed_tracks#Architecture
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (11:02): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: do you envision <track> being used for audio/video captions in the future? or separate <audio>/<video> for that use case?

66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (11:02): so, looks like the intention is that CSS applied to <video> cascades to the external tracks, which I guess does make sense if one wants to style multiplexed tracks too (cc cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0)
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (11:04): http://damowmow.com/temp/srtspec
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:04): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: i expect we'll have to sync multiple media elements, rather than have them be part of <track>
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:04): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: since basically we'd have to duplicate all of <video> to do overlaid sign language captions
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:05): no plans to do that this time though
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:24): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e,  <span title="dom-MutableMediaTrack-addCue">addCue"> doesn't work
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:29): thx
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:31): sighs at the //head/object thread
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:31): what order should video.tracks be in?
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (11:35): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: first <track>s in document-order, then tracks from the media resource, IMO
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:36): so if you insert a <track>, it renumbers existing tracks?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:36): that'd be a bit weird
fe70b49783daa65bcb249805fb3a2b24 (11:37): you could do the media resource, then external tracks, in which case you can avoid any renumering by always appending
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (11:37): I think with multiple <source>s where only some have internal tracks would be worse, where the script breaks because the order changed
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:37): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c_: you get the external ones first
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:38): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c_: almost always
fe70b49783daa65bcb249805fb3a2b24 (11:38): is it at all common to have both?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:38): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c_: since they are declared in the file, which is likely to be read long before the network returns the video
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:38): s/file/html/
fe70b49783daa65bcb249805fb3a2b24 (11:38): ah, I see what you mean
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:38): btw there's also a third source, which is scripted tracks
fe70b49783daa65bcb249805fb3a2b24 (11:39): I don't think you can avoid renumbering when you add <track>s in the DOM then
fe70b49783daa65bcb249805fb3a2b24 (11:39): unless you give up on the track state being inferrable from the DOM
fe70b49783daa65bcb249805fb3a2b24 (11:39): generally it's good for DOM APIs not to be path-dependent
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:40): well we can add them in first-come-first-served, which trades predictability from run to run for consistency of the index of the objects in the array

66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (11:40): it's quite likely not all browsers will detect the same resource-internal tracks during a period of implementation, which favors putting them at the end where it creates a smaller mess

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:40): or we can do them in a defined order, in which case you can't keep a hold of the position... but then you can keep hold of the object that represents the track, so that's ok
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:40): ok, fair enough
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:41): <track>, then script-added, then those in the video file

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:41): should the <track> ones be sorted in the order they were inserted into the <Video> element, or in DOM order? I guess the latter, if they are removed when you remove the <Track> element
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:45): DOM order is what most collections do
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:45): apart from some esoteric form collection iirc
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:46): should it be possible to dynamically change a track's kind, label, and language?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (11:47): if it's represented by an element and those things are attributes, it would be weird if you couldn't
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:47): i guess so
